characters: A SERIES OF SHOTS FROM A MOVIE BEING PROJECTED ON A SCREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sprawling impressive mix of Colonial, Gothic and Mod architecture is presented like a living brochure.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: As we cut through the living brochure, we're presented wi groups and programs. Their CRESTS and titles SUPERIMPOSED

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: 3A   White kids with "Trump" blazers and glares - DESMOND SCHOOL OF BUSINESS. 3B   Kids with dark eye circles and unkempt hair stand be the BING SCHOOL OF HISTORY. 3C   A cluster of skinny jeans and expressive hands befor GOODMAN MEDIA SCHOOL. ONE BLACK KID stands in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People. The minimum requirement of Black friends needed to not seem racist has just been raised to two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha White (Sam) watches the campus through a one way window with the cool but knowing gaze of someone much old She gets off on sensing and pushing buttons - with a subversive delivery style that boarders on deadpan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, but your weed man Tyrone does not count. She fades in JAZZ on her control board and leans back to address a box of pamphlet sized books bearing the title "EBONY AND IVY: A SURVIVAL GUIDE." One by one she scribbl her autograph on the books.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Disheveled caffeinated writers of the MANCHESTER BUGLE. 5A   Casual Prepsters shoot us the finger - PASTICHE HUMO 5B   Hopping out of a taxi is Lionel Higgins. His sweet b insecure nature as plain as the unkempt fro on his head.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: STUDENTS shove past him - one even slaps a flyer into his already full hands. Lionel's a guppy. The kind that gets eaten alive in a tank of sharks. As Lionel gets to the door of a large Colonial style home checks his pockets. He's missing something. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knocking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt! You home? Lionel dials on his cell and we hear the PHONE RING from inside. Voicemail pops on with a voice other than Lionel'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey boyssss, you've reached Lionel Higginsss, the only bitch on campussss who'll give you a dickssscount. That's right hunty, the bigger the dick the less you'll have to pay me to ssssuck it. The beep sounds. Lionel's in shock. Should he hang up? Or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt. It's Lionel. I'm locked out. As Lionel slides down the length of the door into a sit h unfolds the flyer he was just handed. It's a rendering of White on a carton of milk with the caption:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signs scream out "ORIENTATION" as jazz music wafts from t laptops of a group of NEO BEATNIKS. As the music fades...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People, apparently Morgan Freeman in "Deep Impact" wasn't enough. Despite two terms Obama could cure Cancer and somewhere White folks will be embroiled in protest. And he's only half Black. GABE, 24, white and ruggedly handsome in spite of his sha hair and "laundry day" flip flop clad ensemble, catches t end of this as he passes - grabs his cell phone and dials

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sam presses a button next to a red light on her contro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me. INTERCUT with Gabe walking about on campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say if someone started a Dear Black People?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing the voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need. Mass media from Fox News to reality tv on VH1 makes it clear what white people think of us.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Manchester's white and rich elite before BECHET HOUSE. 8A   Athletes of many disciplines before WEBSTER HOUSE. 8B   An eclectic group of Black students with some Latino a sprinkling of whites before ARMSTRONG / PARKER HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fucking pissed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colandrea Conners (Coco) trains her unnaturally blue eyes right at us from a Youtube page pulled up on an iPad. She got an entitled air about her. Even her cusses sound erud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I am! The whole point of randomized housing is to mix shit up. I'm out here trying to find the Olivier to my Halle Berry, and they've got me looking like an extra on a Different World... The video ends with a click. Looking up is HELMUT WEST, a 30's something Black man in dark rimmed glasses and trend everything. Too stylish for this place. If he's impressed it's barely perceptible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call your Youtube show "Doing Time at an Ivy League?" He stares right at Coco, there in the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my second year of a four year sentence. Wanted to go to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? And do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things my mama taught me not to. You know get in a lot of trouble and become famous for it. But alas I didn't get into Tisch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armstrong / Parker? That your rooming assignment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traditionally it's where the hopelessly Afrocentric gather to process their guilt over not going to an HBCU. (off Helmut's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the Negros be at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not where you want to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bechet House is more my style. HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the rich white kids. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part of Chicago you from? COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hyde Park. HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What street? COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy Eighth and -- HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Seventy Eighth is Southside sweetheart. And you know what they say. You can take the girl out the hood but -- COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ain't nothing hood about me. HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks so much for coming in. Coco gets up to leave. Tries to recover. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's this show about anyway? HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the way reality works sweetheart, I'm the producer. I ask the questions. Be in touch. And with that Helmut hustles Coco out. He sits and ponder before unmuting his iPad. SAM (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People I am here to burst your post-racial little bubble. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Oprah may have her own network, but Ann Coulter is still writing best sellers, Black kids are still getting shot for wearing hoodies, and even here the few vestiges of Black culture are under attack by conservative groups, trustees and yes our very own President Fletcher. Helmut double checks his app fighting a genuine grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the school radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pristine pair of Retro Jordans make their way through t halls of Armstrong / Parker where Black students have liv debates, flirt and bump the student radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People, thanks to the new process of randomizing housing assignments for Sophomores, some of you may be jarred by an assignment to Armstrong/Parker house. The owner of the Jordans is revealed as Troy Fairbanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone turn that trash off.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Even with his post workout sweat he looks like the cover Jet. Troy exudes "approachable homie" as he spots a small group of WHITE SOPHOMORES who walk timidly down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newbies right? The white sophomores nod their heads yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Armstrong / Parker, home of the dopest dining hall in all of Manchester. I'm Troy, Head of House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up my brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When encountering a Black person try and stay calm. Don't say things like "what's up" and "my brotha" That's not how you normally talk. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll take care. Nice Jordan's bro. Coco and SOFIA FLETCHER, a dewy-eyed, pink lipped brunett who exudes a kind of sexy boredom saunter down the halls. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair is so cute B. T. Dubs. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so cute. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it weaved? Coco's face is a battle between fury and polite surprise. SOFIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw "Good Hair" in Afro studies. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving on) Hey what house did you get? SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh Bechet bitch. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. The mere thought of a Fletcher anywhere else... SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, it was the luck of the draw. Daddy had nothing to do with it. Coco rolls her eyes behind a smile. SOFIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And honestly, if I had to pick anywhere to be it'd be here. Sofia eyes the delicious morsels of chocolate boys about. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm down to switch if you are. You get your Denzel. I get my Gosling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I got mines. Want to meet him? They turn the corner to spot Troy greeting more new Sophomores. Coco's caught off guard by his looks. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute... (off Sofia's jealous glance) ...for a Black boy. Troy sees Sofia and flashes his trademark grin. They kiss SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey boo. This is my friend Coco. She's new to the house. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey I'm Troy. Welcome to Armstrong / Parker, home of the dopest -- SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Are we on duty? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head of House is always on duty. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. I should get settled. Thanks Sof! Sofia and Troy smile as Coco turns to go - and continue d the hallway. Coco sneaks one last glance at Troy's ass. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I got time for a quick cut? SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it cut last week. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Black thing babe. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when is OCD a Black thang? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say "thang" like that. SOFIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides you've got a shift at the Politicos booth, then a shift at Orientation, then your advisor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll just wear a hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a movie maybe? Just us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Election night. Babe, come on. Sofia holds her tongue. Troy ignores this as he spots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Kurt my man.

dialogues.speaker: DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: ...Kurt Fletcher - flanked by guys who share his cynical knowing glare. We recognize them from the "Pastiche" port from before. As they chow down on Mac & Cheese in the Dining Hall glare burns particularly hot towards Troy who waves at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sis. Sofia smiles at her brother Kurt. Troy covers the sting o his dismissal. They both spot Sam's "Missing: Black culture" flyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she kidding with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to run again. Just because it's her doesn't mean --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I can't let Sam and her wannabe Black Panthers take the House. The House needs me. This is who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's who he wants you to be. Troy smiles over his irritation. This is an old fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh so you pick up a Psych class you think you Freud or something? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Freud reference. Sophisticated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seducing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine Beck, Jung, Maslow... Troy gets a kiss out of her as they pass a booth featurin stacks of Sam's "EBONY & IVY." The booth is manned by 21, Black - his fro top and preppy punk attire is both bohemian and radical. Troy glares at Sam's picture on the book. It's on. There' history between Sam and Troy. Off Reggie's laptop we hear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People, this just in. Dating a Black person to piss off your parents is a form of racism. Sofia walks off as Troy hears snickers from around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Troy I forget. Is your major in shucking or was it jiving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My major's in Jive. Minoring in Shuck. You're still majoring in trying to fuck my left overs right? Troy walks off as Reggie and Kurt watch him join Sofia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water runs while Troy takes a hit of weed from a pipe ove the toilet. He blows the smoke out an open window through paper towel tube with a dryer sheet attached to its end. jots something down on a notepad as he whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went from ODB to Trey Songz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall is packed with STUDENTS - stylish and mostly Bla Helmut West watches from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artie, you know your success ratio with the ladies went up like thirty percent after I started edging you up dog, come on. You went from ODB to Trey Songz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is in STITCHES at this last line. Everyone except Sam, Reggie and their crew of afro'd bohemian disciples (who we'll call the BOFROS). Sam records the proceedings with a vintage Super 8 camera. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his platform? Haircuts? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oofta is as Oofta does. Coco, sneaks through the door. She's got the eyes of Helm on her. What is he doing here? As Coco breaks eye contact sits in the only open spot next to... SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because we're colored don't mean we run on colored people time. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boycotting hot combs don't make you an expert on "colored people" boo. Coco wafts her silky hair over her shoulders and sits. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No but seriously, I care about you guys. I care about this house. We had a great year last year and if it ain't broke... Troy basks in his applause. Coco eats him up with her eye Sam doesn't want to get up - her breathing gets heavier. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pretend like you're in the booth. Just you and the mic. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate this shit. As Sam gets up and passes Troy -- TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think you can take this from me? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy we live in a world where there's a Big Momma's House 3. I don't have a chance in hell. Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam grabs the mic. Her voice shakes before the silent cro SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy my brother, it's broke. The BoFros cheer and make noise on each line. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy's a legacy kid. And yet it's under his watch that Armstrong / Parker, the bastion of Black culture here was gutted. By the Randomization of Housing Act. Second years of color no longer have a say in where they go. The culture that's been fostered in this house for two decades will be wiped out in two years. Troy looks to see if the speech is working. As Sam warms SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't motivated by a desire to mix things up. Bring about racial and socioeconomic harmony. No, the Black kids are sitting together in the proverbial cafeteria and they must be up to no good. Coco's eyes are in the back of her head. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sit together to protect ourselves. Over a century of houses grouped by sports affiliations, political leanings, majors, you name it. Black folks get their own house, suddenly we got a problem? Students look at each other stunned. Are they turning? Sa delivers the next one directly at Sofia and Troy. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Act doesn't affect the other houses like it does ours. There are plenty of trustees, former coaches, and presidents watching out for the others. All we have is a Dean who'd rather please his massa -- TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yo that's enough of that Sam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then stand up for his own. Look, I know ya'll ain't voting for me. Ya'll ain't ready and I didn't come here for that. The Black Student Union and I have brought a petition to repeal the Randomization of Housing Act. I plan on bringing it to the President and together we can bring Black back to Manchester. It'll be by the door. Sam sits as claps trickle from the crowd. The BoFros go c - give her daps and all sorts of praise. MARTIN, 20, a gentle erudite giant of a football player w neat braids tucked under a Fedora raises a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume everyone has the app I created by now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a child's app...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Voting may commence. Everyone takes out smart phones. Reggie hides his from vi as he punches something in. Troy spots the white Sophomores he greeted from before wh give him a head nod. Troy's got this. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Looks like we've got ourselves a winner. (devastated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam White? The blood drains from Sam's face and Troy's smile plummet into the floor as the two turn to look at each other. TROY & SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Reggie's grin is from ear to ear as Helmut walks over and slips a card to a still stunned Sam. Coco watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on the heels of Helmut's exit is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for good TV sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd be good TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're at a great school, getting a great education. Be good at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. And when I graduate early with an Economics degree from Manchester it will be the crowning achievement of my Black middle class parents' ambitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conflict is a commodity in my industry. Sam's got it. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want me to start a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exactly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to do anything you wouldn't otherwise do. Helmut hands her his card. A fire sparks in Coco as he ex He contemplates her. Fights a growing smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fireplace rages behind Lionel who stares at the floor w the message plays over speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...bigger the dick the less you'll have to pay me to ssssuck it. Dean Fairbank's mind ticks away behind a concerned glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most everything's locked up, but we'll find another residence to move you to. Third time's a charm. (off Lionel's sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Armstrong / Parker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have an opening. Maybe it'd be good to be around...you know. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean. The worst thing about high school, and believe me it was a long list, were the Black kids. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's in your head. Sure, sometimes our folks can be intolerant around people like you. Homo -- LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't believe in labels. Fairbanks just smiles. This is a sore spot and he backs o Lionel glares up at a poster above Fairbank's desk: Stude of all races on the steps of Ellington Library including with the phrase "MANCHESTER: WHERE YOU BELONG" printed be Troy's huge smile seems to mock him. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like jazz Lionel? Manchester's like jazz you know. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a research school. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And jazz is tension. The interplay of improvised solos all creating one song. Your problem is you've got no instrument. No major, no affiliations, no solo son. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I submit articles to the Independent Observer. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one reads the Independent Observer, my point is are you playing swing or bebop? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mixing metaphors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a sax or are you a trumpet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate jazz. Fairbanks checks his watch. All out of ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do what I can. Not a word of this in the Observer okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it matter? No one reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel walks alone through the buzzing campus. He looks o to.. ...a group of BLACK KIDS. He sees a version of himself amongst them - his hair a finger waved Ceasar fade, as he trades "No Homo's" with the others. Lionel shakes it off. Peers over to a group of out and pr gay kids and sees a version of himself amongst them - his hair straightened and coifed in a fitted shirt laughing. Not right either. Where does he fit? By surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel right? GEORGE PIERCE, 24, an intellectual whose tattooed quotes Nietzsche peek out seductively from under his button up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George. We had Civ last semester? How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grood...Gate...I'm ah..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fan of your stuff. In the Observer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one reads the Observer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen this? George hands Lionel Sam's "Missing Black Culture" flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The residents of Armstrong / Parker just made her head of house. Am I crazy or is there a there there? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What made you come over here? George holds up Sam's "Ebony & Ivy." Lionel takes it. LIONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I'm glad you came -- GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- My staff? God bless them. They're whiter than Michael Jackson's kids. We're fucked if anyone of them writes this story and I will not let the transfers at the Gazette do it first. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The oldest one has his face. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the Black Student Union. You probably know Sam. Lionel shakes his head "yes" and "no" at the same time. GEORGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come up with a good angle? I want it in the Bugle. Lionel eyes the bold "Bugle" logo on George's shirt. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside) Trumpet... GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bugle. Focus. The only paper on campus with a national subscription base and an Advisor from the New York Times? Only so many ways a person can distinguish themselves at a place like this Lionel. You're good. You belong with us. The way Lionel fights the smile creeping up his face - we know he's never heard these words. Never belonged any pla Doesn't hurt there's a handsome boy smiling at him either

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Sam sit across from each other at a table. Their opposite facing laptops and a world of tension put a wall between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it yet? Sam shakes her head yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You've now got the shared calendar, contacts, and official email. Troy throws a smirk her way before pulling out a thick st of papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and before I forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Event requests for the year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just this month. They need your approval. Also don't forget to pick your office hours. At least 20 per week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in charge of a hundred residents now. And they need time to complain to your face. About noise. Leaky pipes. Gluten free options in the cafeteria. Etcetera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy. I didn't think I was going to win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way petitioning the President on the Randomization of Housing Act isn't gonna do shit. None of the other houses are concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they all have a legacy of rich and powerful allies on the board who will make sure that "random" works out to their advantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think a petition is going to change that? Troy gets up to leave as Reggie sits - suspicious. Sam's phone buzzes: "MOM." The letters chill Sam to the core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel steps his way through the hall, a deer in headligh with a notepad. He flips through Sam's "EBONY & IVY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Armstrong / Parker dining hall is the epicenter of Black culture as it stands at Manchester. Only here can you commiserate, celebrate and discuss everything from Kanye West lyrics to theoretical relativism all in one sitting. Not to mention find someone who can actually do your hair.

dialogues.speaker: ARMSTRONG / PARKER DINING HALL
dialogues.text: Lionel enters and takes a place in a line. He absorbs thi lively and somewhat alien dining hall. Troy now holds court near the windows at a table of eight so friends including Martin and SUNGMI, a lip ringed Kore art major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We wuz robbed." That election was suspect man. Martin glares at Reggie and his giant souped-up Laptop. S breaks this by sitting back down - her phone call ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call me the minute there's an update. Love you too mom. Sam hangs up. The call's really put her in a bad place. S sits at a table of her Bofros - who we'll name by their h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CURLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one other sister in my Relativity class, I'll be damned if our professor doesn't call me Laretta every God damn time. DREADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all look the same. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Programming professor gets me and Martin here mixed up constantly. MARTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be so lucky. Reggie glances over at Martin's Mac Air. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute. You get that at Toys R Us? Sam pulls out her Mac and her student ID card. REGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still using your ID number? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always forget passwords. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are begging to get hacked. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing the one evil techno- genius thinking like that is on my side. Sam pushes aside all the paperwork on her table. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is what the revolution looks like? Office hours and paperwork. Sam pulls her camera out - starts to shoot the room. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winning was a happy accident. We want the reform repealed right? CURLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means to an end, sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam feels the heat of her disciples' eyes on her as the t of the day rages on with the entrance of Coco, who sits w a group of well manicured hot-ironed group of girls, whit and Black. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The talented tenth always has to bust its ass a little bit harder, but I don't see the benefit in blaming white folks for everything. CURLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's blaming? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see the issue. I never had one. Never ran into any lynch mobs. Lionel takes a seat alone facing the action. Kurt and crew enter with plates of mac and cheese and sit the heart of the conversation. Lionel avoids eye contact. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch mob is still there. Just re- branded itself. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As what pray tell? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Republican party. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to know how this world sees you? Go to a Young Republican's meeting and bring up Welfare. SUNGMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Immigration. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside) Or gay equality. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. MARTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. Got something to add? KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biggest athletes, movie stars, hell your president is Black. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KURT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think the hardest thing to be in the American work force right now is an educated white guy. SUNGMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not serious. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys still got affirmative action, you're set. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in here? KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obama. Leader of the free world got into Harvard on affirmative action. Know who's not president right now? The guy that didn't get in. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On behalf of the colored folks in the room, let me apologize for all the better qualified white students whose place we're taking up. Kurt chuckles - a bit turned on by the argument. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get lost? Bechet is that way. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but what other dining hall gives you chicken and waffles? Dear White People right? Funny stuff. How haven't we staffed you yet? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Pastiche? Your uninspired humor magazine? KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a lot more than a magazine sweetie. SNL staff is basically half Lampoon, half Pastiche. Just like the network comedies. A flash of envy comes over Troy and Coco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gives you Clubhouse kids the right to come to our Dining Hall? Kurt eats an exaggerated scoop of mac and cheese. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't live here. MARTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? What are you doing? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't eat here. Kurt eyes this new adversary. Enjoys a good challenge. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill Sam damn. Let the man-- KURT & SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I got this. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you to put me out? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) I'm the Head of this house. And I'm doing things my way. Sam shoots this last one to Martin. Kurt rolls his eyes t which Sam slams his tray to the ground. Lionel scribbles down notes furiously on a notepad. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any idea who you're -- SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, I know who your daddy is. The same one who's been pushing to break up this House for a decade. What's wrong? Is he scared letting the Negroes gather in groups might start a rebellion on the plantation? You tell him from me...he should be. Kurt looks into Sam's eyes and then his crew. They want o KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt leads his crew out of the dining hall drawing a slig snicker from Lionel which draws Sam's eyes right to him. Something sparks in Lionel. He takes out his phone and te to GEORGE: "I've got the angle. I'm in."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your house? Lionel sinks - the eyes of everyone in the room on him. Sam sits back down as a trickle of claps grow to a steady applause. Troy and his table look around baffled. By the caution on Sam's face it seems the first time she' ever heard this sound directed at her. A slight envy boils in Coco. One last look to the room from Lionel before he slips out Locked out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco scrolls Sam's "Dear White People" Youtube page. 75K Subscribers. She presses play on the latest video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People, stop dancing. Two seconds. 600K views.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck? Coco exits and opens her own "TIME AT AN IVY LEAGUE" page subscribers. Her latest video is at 10K views. Alright... presses record. Let's the camera rest on her briefly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffins. I hate to do it, but Imma have to get real Black with you. (comes to mind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the other day, a girl had the nerve to fix her mouth and ask me if my hair was weaved. (after a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weaved. Weaved bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all if you're going to fix your mouth to ask me something like that, say it right please? It's weave. Noun. Present tense. Second of all don't assume just because you see a sister with some hair it's a weave. Is it? Clearly. If a bitch could grow straight Indian hair directly out her own head I wouldn't have just overdrafted my account paying for this shit but that ain't your business. Are those your lips sweetie? Sweet heart is that really your skin? These white girls and these tans I swear to God, they're starting to look darker than me. Coco pauses it. Her mouse hovers over the check box next "private." Instead she plays it back...and hits "publish. She clicks back through to Sam's last video and hits "rep As the red light on her computer's web cam turns green...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People. What do I think about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam with arms folded watches as Gabe (Sam's caller from earlier) presses play on a DVD. Horrified students watch. ...a Black and white 1920's style silent movie, complete Dialogue Cards and dramatic PIANO MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: A) OBAMA speaks at a debate B) DIALOGUE CARD: "We are the change that we seek." C) A FAMILY in white-face go ape-shit

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: E) More intercut footage of Obama speaking with actors in white-face reacting. Until...

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: G) A WHITE-FACE CROWD goes nuts in the streets - scream i camera - loot buildings and shoot themselves in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H) Dialogue Card: "FIN" PROFESSOR BODKIN, late 40s, with a "seen it all before" demeanor hides a grin and lets the room settle. PROFESSOR BODKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Does anyone have any comments for Sam's "Rebirth of a Nation?" All of the kids are too scared to comment. Except... PROFESSOR BODKIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, go ahead. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dig the "silent movie" thing, but it's a little self-congratulatory. Light on story and frankly thematically dubious. PROFESSOR BODKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Anybody else? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SAME PLACE
dialogues.text: As students filter out of the class... PROFESSOR BODKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you say anything might I remind you that I sat through Birth of A Nation, Gone With The Wind, and Tarantino week without protest. PROFESSOR BODKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And might I remind you that I read all fifteen pages of your unsolicited essay on why Gremlins is actually about suburban white fear of Black culture. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gremlins are loud, talk in slang, are addicted to fried chicken and freak out when you get their hair wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My only problem with your movie is that it was late. The silent projects were last semester Sam. You were supposed to have emailed your sound treatment over Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been getting footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your senior thesis Sam, where the hell is your head at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Radio, BSU, this Head of House thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Do you want this? Cause if not, don't waste my time here -- Sam pulls out the Super 8 camera from her satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Look this thing might as well be my right hand Professor. I was busy this summer that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With everything but your major? While your peers are taking internships, making short films...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad. He's sick. Had to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need some time off, take it. But if you want to make it to next semester --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Pull it together. This is Manchester. Sam wants this. It's in her eyes as she holds her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam exits the theater and spots Gabe talking to some guys

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thematically dubious? GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what was that supposed to be about exactly? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thematically dubious! Gabe rolls his eyes and catches up with her. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do TA's give critiques? GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You invoke Minstrelsy for shock value, but to what end? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To invoke the same feeling I get when I turn on the TV and see some so-called reality star shuck and jive for ratings egged on by no doubt white producers. Or the sassy Black secretary with no backstory or character development aside from their skin color. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's a tit for tat?                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're honestly saying that art             * can't be reactionary?                       * GABE                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're reacting to a work made              * almost a hundred years ago.                 * SAM                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes because fear of Black men being         * involved in the United States               * Government is a completely                  * antiquated concept. No social               * relevance whatsoever today.                 * GABE                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly I just think sometimes its          * better to hold a mirror up to your          * audience than to drop an                    * ideological piano over their head.          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly I just think works that                        * deal with the African Diaspora                         * through a post-modern lens are                         * outright rejected unless they're                       * handled by a white artist.                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: African Diaspora? Really?                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war rages as the two continue up a fleet of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackface is alive and well in our culture. Who primarily buys hip hop? Watches Housewives of Atlanta? The same homogenized images of Black people over and over again? White people Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who goes to see Tyler Perry movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're an underfed community. None of this changes the fact that the vibrancy, the complexity of Black culture has been distilled into commodities and marketing schemes to be bought and sold--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --to the detriment of the so called "real thing." Got it. And into a room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am indistinguishable from the so called "urban" images used to amuse and market to white America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the commodification of culture is uniquely oppressive to Black people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods fervently as Gabe grabs and unbuttons her jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when Kanye raps about Louis V and Rolexes and Classical Art, exactly what exploited pocket of Black America are those references being mined from? Sam can't get her shirt off fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your knees. Gabe kneels below frame as Sam closes her eyes in ecstacy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's eyes pop open - a startled scream escapes her lips. She's surprised at first to see Gabe beside her in bed, t outside spoon. They're both naked. Her pompadour frayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You dream in "Cosby" again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hair was so straight. My sweater so big. I told you about that? Sam's phone buzzes. Gabe grabs it and sees Reggie's photo up. He swallows his envy and hands it to Sam. She doesn't answer. Silence as it hits her voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey so...this whole "Head of House" thing. Congrats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's...it's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird, right? Never took you as a student politician... Reggie's photo again - New Voicemail. A regret in Sam's e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... Sam rolls out of bed. Gabe thinks twice before he asks it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She badly wants to give him the answer he wants. Instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie stares at Sam with stars in his eyes as she effortlessly addresses the campus in between bits of jazz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People. Please stop touching my hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel at an ancient oak dining room table listens to the broadcast over his laptop. Makes studious notations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this look like a petting zoo to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel gets an IM: "George: Hey handsome, how's the story To which Lionel writes: "Going great sexy." Lionel delete "sexy" and replaces it with ":)" before hitting send.

dialogues.speaker: 29A BAR DIVIDE
dialogues.text: Across from Lionel is Kurt flanked by his eager but self conscious right hand GORDON - and MITCH, swagged out vars crew captain and connoisseur of all things Black culture. They wear "PASTICHE" gear, hunch over a glowing iPad and scroll through a series of student group photos in the Yearbook. Kurt stares off into space, turns up the GANGST RAP playing from a nearby blue tooth speaker. Kurt pours shots of Jack which Gordon eyes with caution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt it's three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y.O.L.O. my nigga!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone takes the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't even have our new staff yet. Why are we planning this? KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone wants to be on our staff that's the easy part. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to make staff bids on Game Night, and the RSVP's are through the roof for that. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but Halloween is our premiere party. The waitlist is already a hundred deep and it's going to take a lot to outdo this summer. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinco de Mayo was epic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black and white photo of Kurt and crew dressed in Sombr and Mexican stereotypes at a wild pool party. The title reads... PASTICHE PRESENTS "WETBACK" GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the Young Republicans? KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too close to the Tea-Party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo of Kurt and crew dressed as famous female political conservatives - brandishing rally signs with misspellings cups of tea. The title reads... "PASTICHE'S TEA PARTY" MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo we need an East vs West hip hop party. Get the honeys in here. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The honeys?" You're from Vermont. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys what's the Pastiche motto? GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sharpen thy sword."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our motto is a euphemism for masturbation? GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a reminder that satire is the weapon of reason. So who on campus is being unreasonable? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a reminder of how gay you are. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that even a reasonable attempt at a quip Mitch? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Gordon, say reasonable again. SAM (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People, knowing Lil' Wayne lyrics no longer earns you an Honorary Black Card. It just reminds me how often you say the word "nigga" when no one Black is around as is required in reciting said lyrics. Kurt turns up his music and shoots Lionel a look, who plu headphones into his computer and looks down. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell does Sam think she is? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Spike Lee and Oprah had a pissed off baby. Kurt shares a glance with Mitch and Gordon - they're lean towards the same idea. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we? GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? Kurt turns his heat towards Lionel - has a bone to pick. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Lionel. Talked to the Dean today. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a very enlightening conversation. I just want to say... I'm sorry about the voice message.

dialogues.speaker: 29B DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Kurt and his crew cross over to Lionel's table. Kurt unzi his pants silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you accept? Lionel removes the headphones and turns to Kurt, just as starts flopping his dick around off screen. Lionel quickl looks in the other direction. Kurt's friends crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please put that away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to talk to these people in a language they'll understand. Lionel shoves his headphones back on over his fro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever he ships you off to, be sure to pack a sense of humor with you, kay bro? Lionel drowns them out. He flips through Sam's "Ebony &am book to a section called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paper Bag Tests. As Lionel reads we swish pan to...

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DINER
dialogues.text: ...an abstract Diner set. Sam at the counter addresses us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tip Test. You hit up Jelly's for a snack. Your waitress mistakes you for someone who looks like you (Black) who once ran up a thirty dollar bill and left a dollar tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS, over it, crosses frame and glares coldly at us. Lionel takes a seat at a booth with Sam across from him. SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch all the other customers order before you do... Waitress huffs her way over to Lionel. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pastrami sandwich on rye. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then proceed to wait no less than forty minutes for your food. A wall-clock advances forty, before the food and check co SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you tip? A... LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty minutes? Man she's lucky I leave her forty cents. You do a good job, maybe you'll see a tip. SAM

dialogues.speaker: B...
dialogues.text: LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris was tripping, but fifteen percent is the least I can do. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or C... LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reject the stereotype that African American's don't tip. I'm leaving her twenty, no twenty five, just to prove I can!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel's back in reality. He ponders the scenario. LIONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: He turns the book upside down and reads the small print o the bottom of the page. "A) ONE HUNDRED" "B) OOFTA" and h answer "C) NOSE-JOB."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nose-job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The campus has settled into the semester as students trud back and forth to class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People in a shocking reversal using the term "African American" is borderline racist now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean Fairbanks and PRESIDENT HERBERT FLETCHER, 50's in an even better suit than Fairbanks listen to the radio. Fairbanks eyeballs Fletcher - tension between the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out if you're too worried about Political Correctness to say "Black", odds are you secretly just want to call us niggers anyway and truth be told I'd rather you just be honest about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free speech my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stalin quotes for two hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, was I supposed to take "Free speech my ass" as a legitimate suggestion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your office's issue Walter. Especially after that episode with Kurt in the dining hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every race issue is my issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a student issue. You are the Dean of students aren't you? The two share an old and heated glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRESIDENT FLETCHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Times has been watching us like a hawk. Last thing we need is some "race war" on newspapers across the country. How do you think our donor base will feel about that? Our fund- raiser is four weeks away. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad is this deficit of yours? PRESIDENT FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse. But let me tell you something. If this blows up any further? It's on you Walter. Racism is over in America. And if anyone's still dealing with it, it's the -- I don't know Mexicans probably. Troy pokes his head in. Fairbanks cuts the radio off. PRESIDENT FLETCHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Fletcher. PRESIDENT FLETCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, call me Herb. Fairbanks grits his teeth as Fletcher exits and Troy sits DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Fletcher tells me his son got his ass handed to him. Troy hates this game. DEAN FAIRBANKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bout time. Can't tell you how many instances I had to defend Armstrong / Parker when I was Head of House. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's out of line. Kurt's alright. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're supposed to be better than alright. Since when do we lose elections Troy? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Housing Act passing without a fight didn't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I told you about excuses? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops my course load is full anyway. I'm head of Econ Board, I'm thinking about Pastiche. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pastiche? On Kurt Fletcher's staff? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know to round out the res? DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be God damned if twenty years from now you have to end up working for that dumb asses son. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (put in his place) Yes sir. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher and I graduated a year apart. He barely made it through. I graduated Summa cum Laude. Now look who's President and who's Dean. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference? DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple hundred grand a year. Understand what I'm saying? Now what happened between you and Sam to make her come after you anyway? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sofia. You remember Sofia? Daughter of the President. Psych major. "Has the world ahead of her Troy." DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like your tone boy. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry sir. DEAN FAIRBANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you lost the House. On to the school presidency then. The light in Troy's eyes dims a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be good to show this campus is capable of electing someone like you as school president.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy hovers over the toilet - smokes weed while the showe runs - exhales through his paper towel / dryer sheet apparatus. He jots down on a notepad and LAUGHS to himsel

dialogues.speaker: TROY'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Sofia has her face to the floor - peering underneath the bathroom door. She can see Troy's feet. What the hell? Off the SQUEAK of the shower being cut Sofia jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Troy bounds out the bathroom in his undies. Sofia on the couch pretends to have been watching television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe. Hat or no hat? Troy stands before her in his undies holding a Kangol. He eyes her oversized T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you wearing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to be. Sofia yanks Troy to her by his underwear to kiss his nave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey boo...why don't we put some of your new found free time to good use? It's been a while since...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with all this boo stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...since you fucked me with your big Black cock. Troy pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It used to turn you on when I talked like that. Is it me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we please just, get ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? I hate my brother's friends. Troy thinks over his next words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to go with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd go without me? Troy tries to flash a charming shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my guest! Sofia gathers some books and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can hang out while I'm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Okay, what's with you and my brother? Are you in love with him? Is this like, some DL shit? Sofia storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "DL shit!?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel walks up the darkly lit stairs of a very old build He reaches a door marked "Newsroom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel looks around the dimmed office. There is music and light coming from a room past all the cubicles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...An office filled with computers. George and a few othe EDITORS scream with laughter - beers and pizza in hand. GEORGE does a beat on his desk while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keeps it clean Ya know what I mean. I drinks my Vodka straight, like I'm a fiend. ANNIE, a strawberry blonde laughs in George's lap. Lionel envy shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, quiet I want to hear this. Annie turns up a Youtube video of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could grow straight Indian hair out my head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmigod, this is going on Facebook. Annie swivels in her chair only to SCREAM BLOODY MURDER a the sight of Lionel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax the Negro at the door is not here to rape you. Annie laughs. The mood is drunk and light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is what editors do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking a break, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted me to drop in and tell you how the story was coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah like this week. It's Saturday night. You got nowhere else to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was this or the new Madea movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God. Where does Madea go this time? Dialysis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, flanked by Reggie and the BoFros are in mid rant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man fuck Tyler Perry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, can we have a movie with, you know characters in them? `Stead of stereotypes wrapped in Christian dogma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is every educated person inherently evil? Why this Nigga gotta be in a mutha fucking dress all the mutha fucking time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come the only Black movies Hollywood wants to make are ones with mammies in fat suits or Black women in pain man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of this is directed at a TEENAGER in the box office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people are here to see Fang 9. (after a beat) Kelly Rowland's in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group throw up their hands and groan in protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game Night and Kurt's house is filled with smoke, music, rich kids who play cards at various tables. Coco, in a banging jumpsuit scans the room for prospects. few eyes from the WHITE BOYS start to flicker her way. Th perks her up, as she arches her back slightly... ...only to see their eyes follow the WHITE BRUNETTE HIPST GIRL who has entered behind her. Coco catches herself in the mirror. What don't they see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy deals cards at a table - the game is Texas Hold Em. holds court - much to Kurt's chagrin. The mood is playful There's a brief eye contact between Troy and Coco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge "Boycott Sal's Pizzeria" poster hangs on the walls Sam's chic dorm surrounded by other street art. The BoFro and a few cool residents of Armstrong / Parker hang about Underground hip hop permeates the room. Sam refuses a joi coldly from Reggie - her eyes fixed on "SCHOOL DAZE" whic plays on her 36' flatscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout you stop stereotyping yourself and put that shit out? This ain't "Friday."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Sam. We got to talk about the protest. When are we are bringing the Housing fight to the prez? Sungmi takes a seat next to Sam. Some kids hop up and sta grooving it out when a new song pops up on the playlist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The House voted down sponsoring the rally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we need it sponsored for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demonstrations can get shut down if a House doesn't sponsor them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the House you're head of? Sam shoots Reggie a glare. He backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Sam, I read "Ebony and Ivy." What's with the Oofta, Nose-Jobs, One Hundred stuff? I miss something? Sam smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to break it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy deals another hand with Kurt, Mitch and Gordon. Troy homeboy swag is thicker than usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo my perfect Friday night is whiskey and my T-Bone Walker records, real talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is T-Bone Walker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a few ways colored folks survive at a place like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh only a pioneer of electric and jump blues bro. Know your roots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White folks always be on stuff like decades too late and act like they discovered some shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oofta" is the jazz age term for Bojangle types who Blacked it up for White audiences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sleep on T-Bone man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock, Jazz, Blues - Nigga whatchu got on right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Public Enemy my Nig--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Yo watch that man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just called him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ya'll get Country Clubs we get to say Nigga. Everyone at the table erupts in laughter. Except Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And golf? And all our girls? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchu mean all your girls? GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, between OJ, Tiger, Wesley Snipes and uh, Troy over here... TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. It's a word for that. Reparations. More Kurt-less laughter from the table. TROY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty white bitches and a mule. Perfectly executed. Troy grins as the table erupts. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Oofta modulates his Blackness up or down depending on the crowd and what he wants from them. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt? KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt. Troy watches this exchange closely. GORDON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy. You thinking about Pastiche? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the magazine right? GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other "magazine" you know has a first look deal at NBC? The third biggest Youtube channel. Talk show. Platinum comedy record homie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't you see him on the talk show Kurt? Kurt looks at his cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small crowd's formed around Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, and a nose-job is a wannabe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco finishes her drink and catches Mitch and Gordon as t start up a Youtube video on their iPad. The previous game over. They watch "Dear White People - 1,378,480 views."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of. Nose-jobs smooth their Black edges and try to blend. Coco runs her fingers through her straight hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People using Instagram. You have an iPhone and go on hikes. I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. Gordon and Mitch turn and notice Coco. Mitch eyes her cur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a fan? Coco makes a "no" face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sup ma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey I know you... Coco is taken aback as Gordon punches up her video and pl it back. She hovers over them. COCO (YOUTUBE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffins. I hate to do it, but Imma have to get real Black with you. Coco a bit embarrassed scans the view count. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Nose-job's worst fear is that their "Blackness" might cause a fuss or draw undue attention so they apologize for it or use it to self deprecate. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty thousand views already? GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like someone submitted you to Buzzfeed. Taking off... Coco leans over them and scrolls down. The first comment from a HELMUT: "Much better..." Coco soaks this in. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wan' a drink a sun'in? COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess you're from Ohio? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vermont. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have against Dear White People? Coco smiles and slyly clicks to her next video. COCO (YOUTUBE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People. How do I feel about it? Well for one it's Blacker than thou propaganda from a bougie Lisa Bonet wannabe who smells like patchouli and frankly I can't believe we're letting Sam get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch and Gordon's mouths are ajar. Coco studies the view count...26,758. A pride strikes Coco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the impromptu party dies down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay and One Hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping it One-Hundred! Being Black as hell just cause. Sam rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about just being you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel's got the eyes of the Bullpen on him. Annie's real warmed to him - her hands play with his afro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only a few ways a person of a color can survive at a place like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright so then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then Sam says "What, is your daddy scared the Negroes are gonna start a rebellion on the plantation?" George goes CRAZY at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Kurt Fletcher!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yes. Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a news item but there's something bigger here. It's a profile piece on Armstrong / Parker and Sam White's pseudo revolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the headline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outdated nationalist seeks purpose starts race war? Lionel's joke hits, but he feels gross for saying it. The image of Sam shaking her head in the dinner FLASHES before Lionel briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beers in the corner. Bang out the news item tonight and we'll work on the profile piece for next week. Lionel grabs a beer and takes a seat at one of the open computers. George starts up a beat on his desk as he and Annie stare at Lionel expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Bugle staffer must freestyle. It's law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be a staffer right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Lionel Kind of like a lion King of the jungle Indigenous to Africa... The beat has long since stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy heads into the kitchen just as Kurt heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo man, you know I wasn't talking about Sof back there with whole forty bitches thing. I was just -- KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- trying to get on my staff? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never really thought about -- KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bullshit. Game Night is where we make our bids for the new staff. It's why everyone's here. You were practically about to bust out a tap dance. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Poly Sci major man. I just came to hang out. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My staff likes you. A lot. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing with you and Sof... TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good to her. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our dad's have been playing a game of chess off and on since 1972. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What and Sof is the White queen? KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a pawn. And I think it's time you get off the board bro. Troy takes this in. KURT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the deal. Every year we throw a party. The point is to mock the self important and moronic entities of the campus. The way to get staffed is to write an invite for the party. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our invites are legendary, we make Gawker, the Post, tons of blogs every year. If your invite is the one that goes out, you're guaranteed a spot on the staff. The runners up are voted on by the rest of us. Troy catches eyes with Coco who gives him a seductive gla

dialogues.speaker: 45A LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Coco turns back to her now enamored crowd. She's in her element with these boys at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think having good hair and carrying on with a degree of sophistication doesn't make me a traitor to the race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to know why they used to call me Black Mitch? GORDON                           COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.                 No one called you that.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Just as Gordon, Mitch and Coco approach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. And what's this year's theme? Kurt rolls his eyes instinctively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still working on that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party's a couple weeks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Kurt. I want you to meet someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys got a party coming up? Coco smiles at Kurt, before flicking her eyes over Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sungmi is one of the last to clear out of Sam's apartment the party winds down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, about the rally. You could still get the permit anyway Sam and go against the board. Most people consider that political suicide though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to rally Sam. Time is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your head Reggie. You think a rally is going to change things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll do a hell of a lot more than a radio show or views on Youtube. Everyone gets quiet. Sungmi takes this time to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we got power Sam and it's time we used it. We earned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We? I didn't see you running for shit Reggie. The Bofros trade looks as Reggie storms out. Sam waits a and rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks after Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't "one word" me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you got to snap at me all the time? I'm around you like twenty four seven. Like your lap dog. I don't even usually get down like that with no red bone chicks man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I thought your ass was Puerto Rican when I met you. Sam turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh so you can dish it out but you can't take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking my ass home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Sam. You know how I feel about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to know how you feel about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Forgive me if I see something in you. Something inspiring. Something folks like me can get behind. Reggie puts his hands on Sam's belt and pulls her in to a kiss as a group walks by. Over Reggie's shoulder Sam sees ...Gabe look back at her. He's heartbroken. She pretends to be affected and sinks into a kiss from Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you'll set up the rally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll set up the rally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt, Gordon, Mitch, Coco and Troy all trade glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ironic. Bold. And don't tell me I'm the only one who thinks Sam White's little movement needs to get cut down to size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreement Coco's gaze. Uncertainty in Troy's. KURT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you got your Hip Hop party Mitch. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Bout time. It's going to be huge man, fucking epic. Kurt holds back a smile. KURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, we've got a lot more mingling to do. We'll be in touch. And Troy? Get off the board bro. Troy chews on this as Kurt leads his group out. Troy smil goes to exit. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice seeing you. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Sofia? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble in paradise? Troy shrugs and heads to the party. COCO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
