dialogues.text: Figures. (off Troy's incredulousness) Nothing. I'm sure you've got something else fair and petite and...fair lined up for that drink. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. I'm not even really into Black dudes anyway. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have you know I'm an equal opportunity employer, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what kind of jobs are you hiring for mister? Coco's stiletto rubs the side of Troy's calf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you and Sofia --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm an accessory to Sofia. Can't ever shake the feeling I'm an assignment for that Afro Studies Minor of hers. Troy nervously glances out at the crowd and then back tow this dangerous and tempting creature before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you have no idea what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel and George walk through the campus at night. Georg waves goodbye to Annie as they pass Bechet House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems really cool. George just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we go too far? You're in Armstrong/Parker right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Garmin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George I'm not exactly down with Sam and I'm not in the BSU. I got kicked out of Armstrong / Parker same as Kurt. But I'm going to write a good story, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. I want a Bugle on your chest by the end of the month. Lionel fights a smile as his heart beats through his ches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the front of Lionel's house. George runs his h through Lionel's hair. Mitch, smoking on the porch with s other kids - trade glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fro's so gnarly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm growing it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night Lionel. Lionel heads up his stoop - past the snickers and glares Mitch and company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party's not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry bro. Invitation only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's two in the morning. Mitch shrugs as humiliation floods over Lionel. Lionel sighs and slumps on the steps outside the door. He scrolls through his phone for a contact...OFFICE OF THE D Starts an email.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy's Kangol sits in the ground, besides his undies, and besides a bright pink thong. Coco's pink painted finger nails travel through the creas of Troy's immaculate abs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colandrea doesn't exactly pass the resume test, you know? I mean couldn't you fucking die? My parents should've just named me Ghetto-ass-hoodrat-anisha. Do you...indulge? Coco fiddles in her purse - pulls out a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ten am. Coco lights it and takes a drag. She hands it to Troy. TROY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mess with that stuff. Coco sees right through him as Troy hits it like a pro. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure about that? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you don't like Black guys? COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl like me is just a placeholder for ya'll at a place like this. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not like that. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Sam would agree. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was different. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it wasn't. Poor thing, she was light skin-ded and everything. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, it wasn't like that alright? Troy's tone sobers Coco a bit. She places a hand on Troy' TROY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pops. He wanted me with Fletcher's daughter. They've been in competition ever since they went here. Pops hates that Fletcher ended up President and he got stuck as the Dean. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So your upbringing may have actually fucked you up more than mine? That's hot. Troy laughs and takes the joint back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell is the difference between a Dean and a President anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently four hundred years of unreconciled oppression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to like you running with the Pastiche boys is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I even get tapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. And you should do it. They all land somewhere big, some before they even graduate. I've seen you in front of a crowd Troy. I bet you could be famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what you want? To be famous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want people to know my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one? Coco's phone buzzes with a message. It's Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want you. Come by Ellington tomorrow at eight. (to Troy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything? Troy checks his phone. Nothing. A decision weighs in Troy eyes as Coco throws on a shirt and gets up to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to stand up to him sooner or later Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Sofia stand still amidst the bustle. Devastation marks her pretty face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you loved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you a lot. Salt meet wound. She wants to go, but something nags at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do in the bathroom? When you leave the shower running? Was it just to get away from me? Troy wagers his answer and decides to confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smoke weed and write jokes. Puzzled by the man before her and too hurt for more, Sofi just turns and walks away. Troy watches her go just as... ...Lionel passes by. The two share an awkward glance befo Troy turns to enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel shyly trudges down the hall of Armstrong / Parker. turns to see Troy behind him. The two avoid the other's g As they both head up the stairs, Troy notes it strange th they're headed in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: 53A UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Lionel heads to a door at the end of the hallway and open with a key. Troy's already at the door when he looks up a realizes Lionel's just entered his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell are you doing? LIONEL & TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dean said it was the only opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head of House doesn't share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not Head of House. Still stings. Troy heads into his room and closes the doo leaving Lionel alone in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel sits alone in front of another bowl of soup. Eyes different cliques of mostly Black students. Dreads walks and shoots a head nod. Lionel uncomfortably shoots one ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay Black, my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing? Lionel watches as Kurt and Troy walk together towards the entrance - suddenly chums. Troy's getting good news and gladly shakes Kurt's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need your submission by Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it bro. The two try and enter, when immediately Dreads slams a GO in the back of the hall - prompting the whole of the dini hall to turn and throw paper balls at Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck? Sam grins from a table comprised of Martin, Sungmi and he other support staff. Martin is visibly annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Troy takes some of the brunt of this and walks with the humiliated Kurt back out of the Dining Hall. Lionel watches with a smirk as Troy talks Kurt down on th other side of the entrance. Lionel catches eyes with Sam briefly who shares the same smirk. He realizes Sam's actually looking at Reggie, perched beh him at a table flanked by Curls and Dreads. They address

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally made it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DREADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been moved around a lot right? CURLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have been terrified when you saw "Armstrong/Parker" written on your moving assignment. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just finishing up. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do Black people scare you? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing its true) No. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too scared to even ask anyone for a cut. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm growing it out. DREADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm growing it out. You're fostering an ecosystem. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you don't come to BSU? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I listen to Mumford and Sons and watch Robert Altman movies. You honestly think I'm Black enough for the union? DREADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I love Robert Altman. Mutha fucka goes in. CURLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) We're not all homophobes you know. Black folks? Lionel's eyes dart around. How did she know? DREADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bumping Frank Ocean right now. I don't give a fuck. Imma still eat at Chik Fil A though. Them nuggets good as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late for class. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the "Black voice" of the Bugle now. We're just trying to decide if you are friend or foe. Reggie pulls a folded copy of the Bugle from under his ar Sam's on the front page with the headline "WHITE STUDENTS

dialogues.speaker: TOLD TO
dialogues.text: REGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to protect our girl. Reggie motions over to a stressed out Sam as she argues o something with Martin at another table. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not on staff. Not until I make good on my assignment, I'm just -- REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Assignment? What's the story? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to do a profile piece on Black culture at Manchester. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of which you are so clearly an expert. Shame floods Lionel's face. REGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's harder man? Being Black enough for the Black kids or the white ones? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being neither. Another GONG sounds with another shower of paper balls. T time it's for... ...Gabe, who's stuck outside. He makes eye contact with.. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! Really Sam? She just looks away. Reggie eyes him coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Bodkin watches over a small class as the studen fill in essay questions. Sam's eyes are glued to a window Outside below the Brofros pull up in an SUV. They hop out start pulling out rally signs and bullhorns. Sam's eyes dart back to the clock as Gabe watches her wat the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam bounds out of a building on her way to the parking lo From behind her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running late. Sam pauses and turns to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your little rally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget your sign Dean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you honestly think this is in the spirit of Armstrong / Parker house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The role of the counter culture is to wake up the mainstream to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I've got furniture older than you. Counter culture? Is that what you think this is? That show of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your show is racist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black people can't be racist. The Dean is rendered speechless at this statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prejudice? Yes. But not racist. Racism describes a system of disadvantage based on race. Black people can't be racist since they don't benefit from such a system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you read the school papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the New York Times a school paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your antics are making press Sam and press like this keeps men like President Fletcher up at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's building a file on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my fault your son couldn't beat me in an election.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it was hard growing up. Wondering which side you fit into. Feeling like you have to overcompensate perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's true, I'm not the only one Dean. Sam walks off in a half jog - Fairbank's last words reson more than she'd like. Gabe, making his way outside just catches her exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge canvas signs with the words "WHITES ONLY" are strewn about the pavement, along with bullhorns and picket signs Sam takes these in while the Brofros feverishly unpack th SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are! We supposed to start at noon. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I had class. There's a vibration in Sam's pocket. Her phone says "MOM. She cuts it off and picks up a "white's only" sign. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are going up on Gillespie. Good right? Sam shrugs in the affirmative but it's too much. Reggie s a doubt in her eyes. REGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. What's that? You're not getting cold feet are you? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean how long do I have to talk anyway? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding right? You're sort of the keynote. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but...you know I think the whole Malcolm X thing is your lane Reg. I'm just not -- REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They came to hear you Sam. Grab a bullhorn. Turn it on. Sam is struck by the command. Stuck between wanting to cu and comply another buzz in her pocket yanks her attention her phone. Sam checks: "IT'S ABOUT DAD. CALL ME" Sam turns for some privacy. She makes eye contact with Ga who's just happened upon the parking lot. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Hey. In the middle of-- -- Okay. Okay. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well up in Sam's eyes as she shakes her head no and heads away from the parking lot and passed Gabe. When Reggie looks up and catches eyes with Sam. His tilte look of indignation asks her what she's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? Sam takes in the scene and decisively turns to go. Reggie heart sinks as a bewildered Gabe goes to chase after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie flanked by the BoFros bangs on Sam's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, what the hell Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banging continues as Sam sits on the edge of her bed. tears have dried. Gabe paces behind the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to tell them to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to wait until they've gone and then head home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to be here for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you be somewhere else for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! I know you're home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see in him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only eligible single brother on campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it. Your parents owned in Harlem or something? You watched "Do The Right Thing" in high school and you want to prove to the world you're down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be down? How long does it take to get your hair like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. We want to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie I will call you later damn! (to Gabe) You don't know what you're talking about. Girls like me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --what? Have to pick a side? I'm sick of your tragic Mulatto bullshit Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't say Mulatto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulatto! Mulatto! Mulatto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Window. Go out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I can't be your Nubian prince on my Black horse ready to take you back to fucking Zamunda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a real African country. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I please get some credit for a solid "Coming to America" reference? Sam tries not laugh at this. GABE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't you Sam. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? And who am I? GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're this...girl... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perceptive. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who...likes to argue with me about every fucking thing. And I hate it because we both know you're smarter than me. Your favorite director is Bergman, but you tell people its Spike Lee. You love bebop, but you've got a thing for Taylor Swift. I know because my Mac picks up your Mac's library. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was so careful... GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like to use phrases from the thirties and wear clothes from the fifties and hairstyles from the sixties. You like to watch me when you think I'm sleeping. And trace the outlines of my face. Sam fights any signs of this moving her. Another BANG. GABE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're more "Banksy" than "Barack" but you've been co-opted as some sort of revolutionary leader or something? But really you're an anarchist. A beautiful writer, artist, filmmaker, shit starter. And beautiful, in general.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's heart beats through her chest. Her phone rings: "Mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Yeah? Yeah. It's okay. Get some sleep. Sam hangs up. A silence hangs - followed by a loud EXHALE from Sam as she let's go of the tension she'd been holdin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His condition's stable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. That's good Sam. Gabe goes to exit just as Reggie BANGS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe! Gabe opens the door to the very shocked Bofros and Reggie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? ...and brushes right past them. Sam gets up and stares do the heartbroken looks on her disciples' faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. And with that she closes the door right on Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco and Helmut look out over the campus from the glowing terrace atop the Library. They sip on coffee's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New videos are picking up steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you I was good TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show I'm scouting for... It's called Black Face / White Place. It's reality. Like a "True Life." Each episode centers on a different one of "us" in a sea of "them."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting? You think they want interesting? Dignified stories of triumph and survival? (off Coco's naive shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want the "authentic urban experience" which is basically network talk for bitching and weave snatching. I'm telling you this because the network is looking to take one of the subjects to series. I got one episode. One shot to find that subject. So if we do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we do it all the way. I'm guessing Sam turned you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. She called me a Bojangling Oofta, whatever that means. Everything else she said would've been bleeped on tv. (off Coco's laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So look, forty thousand hits on Youtube is good. It's not great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about to get a whole lot more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco sits before a video camera. The room is dim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have anyone like you on staff and you had a great idea. We brought you here to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I want to MC it. Your party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to tell you what we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me and in order to get me, you have to let me MC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want to do a live video blog from my Youtube account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd let you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got no choice. They need me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- cause without me ya'll look like a bunch of privileged assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't let people video blog our events...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You got a week to put this thing together boo boo. What's it going to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helmut looks at Coco with a shocked gleam in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Lionel both type furiously at their computers in their rooms. Troy on his invite - Lionel on his article. each look at the other in alternate intervals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...not everyone is as camera ready as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel pauses the episode of STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATIO his TV and heads to...

dialogues.speaker: 67B KITCHEN
dialogues.text: ...bar divide. Pours a bowl of cereal. He glances into Tr room. He's also got Star Trek on. Could it be? Troy, feel Lionel's eyes on him and quickly switches it to Basketbal

dialogues.speaker: 67C TROY'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Troy types in "KURT FLETCHER" in the "To" field and "PAST SUBMISSION" in the subject field. He hits "send" and swal the lump in his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy gingerly enters into the Dean's office. Martin and D Fairbanks talk in hushed tones around Fairbanks' desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, would you share with Troy what you shared with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The server that processes the voting results for House Elections has shut down the A.P. database. Saw it this morning. Apparently the intermediary program is on a refractile loop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Poly Sci major man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam currently has 445 votes. That's 200 more than she had last week during the actual election.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not even that many residents in Armstrong / Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cheated. Hacked the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits before a giant fireplace - twice as large as the Dean's. She faces President Fletcher and fights nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't even begin to know how to do something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your little war really this important? Sam shifts gears slightly - he wants something from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand the pressure to stand for something at an institution like this but you're barking up the wrong tree okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to have been Reggie. Dude's in my programing class. Good. Just forgot to turn his program off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the rightful Head of House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, let me talk to Troy for a bit. I appreciate this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glares at Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your advisor tells me you're hanging on by a thread in you major. Perhaps it's time to reprioritize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to frighten me, but I think you're the one who's scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think you long for the days where Blacks were hanging from trees and denied actual rights. Then you'd actually have something to fight against. A swell of emotion behind Sam's steel eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be facing two hearings in the coming weeks that could end in either Probation or Suspension. One on the merits of your show, the other on your election to Head of House. Sam is truly scared by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your responsibilities to your house are suspended. Your show is done for. And another one of your illegal "demonstrations" will only make matters worse. This is a critical time for this school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You damn right it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have an intolerance problem here. Except for the one I'm looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and his father are alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me you and Sofia had a misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her father. She was very upset. (off Troy's silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy. What sort of vision do you have for yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get my degree. Then Law School and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --And what's that got to do with partying with Kurt? With smoking weed and writing jokes? Panic flashes over Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so what? Is it the spotlight Kurt gets? You want to be on...tv or something? You know how many Black men waste their lives to get on TV? Be rappers and ball players?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wanting it to be true)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad no. I want what we always talked about. Maybe have my own firm someday? Run for office. Make a difference. Wife. Kids. I want all that. I really really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the drugs? God damn it Troy I taught you better than this. I have been in academia a long time, I've seen a lot of things. The men who really run this world? You got no idea what they see when they see you. You are not going to be what they all think you are. You will not give them that satisfaction, you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps out of Fletcher's office into the waiting room. Kurt is there. He stands and the two silently stare the o down as Kurt enters his father's office. A SECRETARY picks up a ringing phone - prompts her to exi the room. Sam watches her sign for a delivery outside thr the window. Sam slips behind the office door - quietly pushes it open listens in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about the party. You picked a hell of a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What party --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're cancelling Kurt. End of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel walks through the empty office - slows down as he hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel's story on the would-be protest outside of Gillespie is running tomorrow and I'm also having Lionel work on a profile piece of Armstrong/Parker like you suggested. Really break down what's going on. Lionel gingerly approaches the door to see George finish phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. It's almost like they recycle so much from their past - Music, food, fashion, and now turbulence. This leaves a bitter taste in Lionel's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. Okay, take care. George can't fight his grin as he looks to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was our Times advisor. He said it's stories like these that get editors recommendation letters. Lionel knocks on the door. Annie and George are startled reassured when they see who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Negro at the door didn't scare you this time. Annie smiles and heads for the door. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel please. You're only technically Black. G, going to French. You want me to hold your seat? GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Annie smiles and walks out. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need something? Saw your e- mail. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I need someone to do the Donor's function on Saturday. Small dinner for the school's big givers. Administration wants a little coverage. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Halloween night. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, which is why no one else will take it. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Thus the new guy. George gathers his backpack and walks over to Lionel. Get close. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way to class, but you can stay and check out last year's piece. You'll do fine. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Are there going to be any racially fueled outbursts at this thing? GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never know right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clear Lionel wants to say something else. George too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I a good writer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get better. And we need you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just a big recommendation away from landing the Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God I hope so. Lionel looks down. He is being used. Turns to go, just as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. -- George grabs Lionel unsure what he wants to say. So instead he just kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad we finally got that Bugle on your chest. Lionel's all mixed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a big party the night of the Donor's event. Call me after, maybe we can hang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sounds good. George heads out - leaving Lionel perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy stares at his reflection in a mirror as he lifts his rag to reveal his perfectly curled finger waves. He's get ready for something. His phone buzzes with a notification: "Message from:

dialogues.speaker: PASTICHE"
dialogues.text: Troy nervously clicks it open. As he reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People. Are you tired of your hum drum, Wonderbread existence of accidental racism and wishing you could sip on Henny out yo crunk cup without a Bitch giving you the side-eye? Course you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As our subjects get ready for their evening. Troy goes back to combing over his finger waves, finding correcting imperceptible imperfections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all those looking to unleash their inner Negro from years of bondage and oppression Pastiche proudly presents "Dear White People" our 89th annual Hallow's Eve Costume Party - tonight at 10 Pacific Time or 5 Colored People Time. Sorry for the short notice, but let's keep it one hun-ed. You've had us on your calendar for weeks. 76A   Lionel stares into a mirror in an ill fitting suit combing out his unwieldy fro. He flinches in pain as he fluffs out each section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dudes must rock FUBU, Ecko, Rocawear, or Sean John. XXXL is the smallest size T-Shirt you can wear, preferably with a collage of Barack Obama and Tupac on it. Stunner Shades, chains, and Blue-Tooth devices sticking out yo ears are also encouraged. 76B   Coco pulls a blonde curly wig over her natural hair smooths her tendrils to frame her face, almost pale with foundation. She begins on her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, we need to see huge hoop earrings, long nails, and cheap tight clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A proper hood rat starts fights, speaks loudly, and when she can't think of the word she's trying to say just makes one up, such as "edumicated." Feel free to fry up some chicken, bring Kool-Aid, Watermelon, 40s, Henny, and of course Dat Purple Drank. No bougie bitches allowed. 76C   Sam removes the pins and the black power Afro pic h up her pompadour fro hair-do, and lets it fall flat aroun her ears. She takes in her image in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally there will be a freestyle rap competition so bring it, get yo shine on and join us for the party of the year! Oh and Nigga Nigga Nigga Nigga. Boy that felt good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter and music from the well to do event wafts outsid while Troy dressed in a slick Armani tux hangs by the entrance. He smokes on Coco's one-hitter from before. Lionel steps out in his ill fitted suit, a camera in hand The two are surprised to see each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny seeing you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father likes to show me off at all the Donor functions. The dessert course is usually my cue to take a breather while they talk shop. (friendlier)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trick is to dazzle them into forking over their estates just before they kick the bucket. Lionel could just leave. Instead he accepts the olive bra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...Picard or Kirk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk. Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you watching Star --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yo what happens in the crib stays in the crib. Not trying to get my card revoked. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, some could argue that a show with Whoopi Goldberg, Michael Dorn and Kunta Kinte himself is a pretty Black show. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? That work out for you? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No it did not. At least not in High School. I bet there's a statue of you at your High School. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was beloved. Won't lie. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they know you were a trekker? TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pops left a paint by numbers template for success at that High School. All I had to do was fill in the blanks. Football captain. Valedictorian. Prom King. Lionel sees a sadness in Troy. TROY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? You're growing that out? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's gaining sentience. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...out there. LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a black hole for white people's fingers. They're obsessed. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I cut hair. Why didn't you ask me? LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're I dunno...you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Lionel, George and Annie pass by the steps to Gillespie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li! You ready man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No costumes? I got a tux for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got out of the staff room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're going as overworked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garmin House. On third I think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third and Basin. I know it. Before Lionel jets to join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo man. If I'd gone to your High School, I'd have had your back. Lionel smiles and heads after his new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel pauses before his old home - now filled with the c of a wild party. Lionel clears his throat and heads in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is dark and rambunctious. Lots of white kids in costume. Some as fairies or ninjas or Spiderman - but mos pimps and thugs. As Blaxploitation characters. As Barack Obama and Condi Rice. As Shaft, Ice Cube, and 2 Chainz. It's a lot for Lionel. Cups are handed to them filled wit "Purple Drank." Everyone downs the stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy is being appreciated by an ancient COUPLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my own firm. Maybe run for office. Make a difference you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple smile. A buzz draws Troy's eyes to his phone - photos from "Dear White People" pop up in his news feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel watches as Gordon and other Pastiche crew nervousl put up flyers and posters. They seem caught off guard. Li glances at the posters - it's Kurt with a large Afro wig mimicking Sam's "Missing Black Culture" flyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is kind of fucked up. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pastiche. The world's most erudite boneheads. Who wants another round? Come on Lionel, help a brother out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitchen's this way.

dialogues.speaker: 80A ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Coco enters the party - blinged out like Nicki Minaj. She feeling herself as she's handed a drink. She's got eyes on her - for the first time like this at a party. But she sees the same thing Lionel saw. Her confidence starts to fight a shame that creeps up ben her party face. She switches her iPhone to video mode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there muffins. How do I look? Why are white folks so obsessed with being Black? And why are Black folks so addicted to Blonde Barbie doll weaves? Honeys it's a strange symbiosis we're here to explore... Coco's voice cracks as she stares into her own image on h iPhone. She pauses it and takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: 80B HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Lionel leads George through the dense crowd towards the kitchen - George pulls Lionel into a hallway and into...

dialogues.speaker: 80C BATHROOM
dialogues.text: ...the bathroom and up against the door. George inhales Lionel's lips. Runs his fingers through Lionel's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Can't wait to cut all this off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare. George plunges his fingers into Lionel's fro once again. Pulls a touch too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could eat you like a Hershey's. This sets something off in Lionel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Lionel breaks George's grasp and heads out the bathroom..

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: ...and back out into the party. He's trapped in a nightma of caricatures and reveling students. Can't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel squeezes his way outside. Something goes off in hi head as he starts walking away from the party. Just then Kurt arrives in front of the house with some friends. Looks at Lionel then at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel paces the halls. His mind churns as he passes the dining hall. Sam and Reggie are engaged in something inte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a genius dude you're a fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it, we did it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask for it Reggie. I look like I betrayed this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well you betrayed me. Sam gets up and storms out - brushes past Lionel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? Can we talk? Sam turns back around fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A turntable is uncovered and rolled out - as a DUDE DRESS LIKE SERENA WILLIAMS starts up a MYSTIKAL record. The crowd starts to get live now. Coco continues to make her way through the party - her fa visibly perturbed by the time she reaches the kitchen. Sh continues out back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sits pulling out a cigarette. She sees Annie put o long straight Black wig and brag to friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey who am I? "Bitch it's weave. Noun. Present tense ho!" Right in the gut. She's playing Coco. Coco grabs her phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt stumbles about the party in a daze. Drunk? Folks giv him props while he searches for and spots Gordon with the others. His phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt, it's me. I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm fucking confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel sits across from Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? Go over there and yell at them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard you yelling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This house is filled with folks willing to take up after a cause Lionel. Believe me. Never would have guessed you'd be one of them but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in my life, I can't just sit around and do nothing. How can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm caught being a part of anything like this...it wouldn't be good for me right now okay? Lionel gets up and walks towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done being everybody's angry Black chick. Sam looks down as Lionel gets up and heads out. Sam's focus shifts to her Super 8 resting by the door and then to a bullhorn directly across from it. Her mind tick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel exits and paces down the hall. He walks by the din room - taken over by Reggie, the BoFros, and a mix of oth students mostly from ARMSTRONG / PARKER.

dialogues.speaker: 86A DINING HALL
dialogues.text: Lionel gingerly walks in the room. He's still an outsider here - but something's changed in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How's it going. Hi. No one answers him - just stay to their own conversations Lionel spots a familiar face...Sungmi. LIONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...what is this? SUNGMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Student Union. Lionel smiles shyly. He should've known that. Reggie, Curls, Dreads and the Bofros hang out at the fron DREADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your call then man. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to everyone) Alright ya'll - thanks for coming out tonight. Looks like Sam's not making it so...let's just call it. The crowd starts to talk amongst themselves, get up and leave. Just then Lionel stands and before he can think... LIONEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh. Excuse me. Hi. I'm Lionel. Some of you...none of you probably know me. I've never been to a meeting. But I just came back from a party on campus and I think you should know about it. Lionel's nerves can be heard in his voice now. He's got t judging eyes of the room fixed silently on him. He sees a open laptop on a desk. LIONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody mind if I? Reggie shifts a bit as Lionel goes to the laptop and pull the party on Facebook. The crowd gathers around as Lionel browses through the photos. LIONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean...I don't know. This is fucked up right? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright brother. What's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel realizes the eyes aren't judging. They're mobilizi Readying for action. Lionel steels himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go over there. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think there's enough of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you don't have a monopoly on being a pissed off minority. Latino's United is meeting across the hall. Asian American League too. (off the stares)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys got better snacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy scrolls through an endless amount of Facebook upload from the party. Forties, bad Afro wigs, fake asses. Shoved in between two RICH OLD WELL TO DOS at a long tabl covered in empty plates and glasses - Troy looks across t his father, in mid exaggerated guffaw with President Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important. There's something happening on campus. I might've...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being rude son. Dean Fairbanks turns away. Troy ponders a moment and then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh am I? How about I tell your precious donors and anyone here who'll listen about the kind of a school it is they're giving to? The Dean can feel the eyes of the Donors and the Presiden him - an outrage comes over him as he pulls Troy aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who you think you are young man but you don't get to talk to your father any kind of way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I say to you is yes sir and no sir! Look I should've brought this up before but -- (off Fairbanks dismissal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- listen to me! Dean Fairbanks tries to cover this moment with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt, still dazed, huddles with his core Pastiche group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah dude. We all got it. I mean, everything's cool right? A noise in the other room startles them...

dialogues.speaker: 88A LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: ...It's Reggie who knocks over a bowl of chips. Dreads ar with a few people. Martin rips shades off a kid's face. T party swarms with BSU kids and their Latino / Asian allie A SMASH yanks Kurt's attention back to the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: 88B KITCHEN
dialogues.text: ...where Lionel smashes bottles of liquor in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel? Kurt yanks the booze from Lionel and shoves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck you think you're doing man? Lionel shoves Kurt into the bar divide. A few of the BSU flood into the kitchen and hold Kurt back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That all you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're putting an end to this Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you I'm calling the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half of this crowd is under 21. A loud AMP sound alerts everyone to the DJ platform in th Living Room.

dialogues.speaker: 88C LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Mitch has taken over the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that mic Before I slap ya Looking for some dykes, that wanna another chapta. If you do me slow, you can do me faster, I'll pass you to the Nigga on my right, he gets you after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Why don't you tuck your tail between your legs, run and tell the Dean and get the fuck out. Lionel sinks from this attack while his posse from BSU watches helplessly as the party goes back into full swing Lionel turns to go and spots... ...George who joins Annie, fresh beer in hand. But right behind George is... ...Sam, having just arrived with her camera in hand point at the rap battle. She winks at Lionel. Lionel turns around - summons something from deep inside. Lionel steps onto the DJ platform and snatches the mic ou one of the rapper's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heyyyy! Hoooo! Heyyy! Hooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is with it - thinks it's part of the show as Li proceeds to freestyle terribly... LIONEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Lionel, Some people call me Li. Lots of people think that I talk kinda white. Well that's alright. Yeah that's cool. I'd rather you think I'm white, than tap dance for you. With that Lionel takes the mic and SMASHES it on the wall then takes the turntable by his hands and flips it over. Sparks fly - the amp goes crazy - the crowd is in shock. Lionel grabs a speaker tower and slams it to the ground. Lionel's off the platform now. Kurt grabs him - Reggie pu Kurt away in his defense. Gordon grabs Reggie - A FIGHT BREAKS OUT. More equipment is slammed to the ground and stomped on as party disintegrates into chaos. Sam dodges fights to capture it all with the camera. Art is being ripped from the walls. Dishes being smashed the ground. Arguments come to physical blows. The steel in Sam's gaze fades. Replaced by...heartbreak? And then she spots... ...Coco squeezing her way through the crowd for the door. Sam's camera and mic stay trained on Coco. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Say it. Come on. Sam stays silent. COCO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may come as a shock, but these people don't give a fuck about no Harriet muthafuckin Tubman. They pay millions of dollars on their tans, their lips, their asses, Jay- Z tickets, you name it, cause they wanna be us. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they got to be for a night.I'm not about to go out into the streets in protest of a Halloween party. Sam keeps her mouth shut and her camera rolling as Coco realizes it's herself she's trying to convince. Coco storms off. Sam exhales and lowers her camera. This new for her. Keeping her mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco trudges down the side walk - yanks off her hair, her lashes, her bling - shedding the shame of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt hustles Lionel out into the yard. Kurt shoves him to ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. I know you can't help it... Lionel just gets back up again only to be slammed down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but why are you such a fag dude? Lionel spits in Kurt's face and pops right back up again. see it in his eyes - he'll never give up. Kurt's hand is on Lionel's collar. He pushes him down aga Kids are all around - some from the BSU - some from Pasti some from the Bugle. Everyone holds an opposite party bac Lionel looks over at his audience and then into Kurt's ey Lionel leans in and kisses Kurt on the mouth long and har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally got me where you want me. Kurt's in shock. He looks at his crew who laugh at him. Lionel sees the surprise in the eyes of his new supporter well. No time to soak this in though. Kurt's let up. For moment. Lionel turns back to Kurt and PUNCHES him in the face. The BSU kids go CRAZY in support. The shock gone - Kurt damn near knocks Lionel out. The world goes all slow motion and out of focus. Lionel s of makes out that Kurt is yanked off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids run in different directions - Flashlights fill the y One is shone directly on Lionel. CAMPUS SAFETY GUARDS and couple POLICE OFFICERS surround him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motor on Sam's Super 8 ticks away. The party is at a complete standstill. Troy enters and looks around in disbelief. Makes eye cont with Kurt who is being held by a Campus Safety Officer. Dean Fairbanks enters and stands in the middle of the cha Sam tip toes in for a close up and holds out a small mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this?

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF SHOTS FROM A MOVIE BEING PROJECTED ON A SCREE
dialogues.text: We see the Dean looking about the party with disappointme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92A   KURT looking bewildered outside his house after the party. We hear BOOS from a crowd. The carnage is devastat Windows are blown out - trash and destroyed furniture on lawn. Ash where fires were put out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do this. Sam. I had nothing to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What some are calling a "race war" has erupted at one of the nation's oldest and most prestigious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92    GILLESPIE FORUM now filled with students who sit be Dean Fairbanks and President Fletcher for a Town Hall. Everyone wears a look of outrage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't condone this egregious event and are investigating its origins. The president and I are looking at ways to address issues of Diversity at Manchester.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSING REFORM
dialogues.text: Applause breaks out amongst the crowd. But so do boos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93    VARIOUS SPOTS AROUND CAMPUS. Students address the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but it's bullshit. Yo this is how we get down. If you can't take a joke in this day and age? The fact we can joke about it proves we've moved on you feel me? This is an attack on free speech! We're the victims here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93A   A series of Busts have been PAINTED IN BLACK FACE o of Armstrong / Parker where Lionel address the camera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard enough for us to even get into a school like this. Let alone succeed. Find our way. This is only a debate because of who Kurt's dad is, which just proves the point. All you did was have a radio show and look what happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93B   COCO as she talks directly to camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this may come as a shock, but nobody gives a fuck about no Harriet muthafuckin Tubman...they wanna be us. So they got to be for a night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93C   A POSTER featuring Troy rendered like the famous Sh Fairy Obama posters with the words "A NEW HOPE" written a the bottom as well as "TROY BROUSSARD FOR PRESIDENT." Thi gets some more applause from the crowd watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I got my dad involved. It was the right thing to do. I didn't mean for all this to happen. All the posters and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'd welcome it? A shot for school president.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think...I'd make more than few people happy if I ran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93D   RADIO BOOTH - where Sam puts her headphones on. She lingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though I'd been expressly forbidden to do so, I wanted to do one last show. Something to sum up the moment. To savor in the pop of the post racial bubble just burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear White People...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to react. Sam takes in a thoughtful breath before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Know what? Nevermind. She fades in a melancholy piece of Be-Bop before hanging headpones up as the title on the projected movie fades in

dialogues.speaker: "...BLACK FACES BY SAMANTHA WHITE"
dialogues.text: Sam stares nervously at the screen as the lights come on, when all at once the room BREAKS INTO APPLAUSE. Sam turns see that the entire room is on it's feet including Prof Bodkin and Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean Fairbanks loosens his tie, flanked by several SCHOOL OFFICIALS. They've been here for hours listening to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once I heard what the group was planning, I sent out an email to the staff to cancel it. You have the email printed in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this? Kurt turns to a SUITED MAN next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94B   We'll be cross cutting between several of these ses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when I got the invite and saw everyone clicking "yes" I figured it was back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were hoping to make the staff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At what point in time did you show up to the event? 94C   Sam sits with arms folded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I even here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94              Guys throw parties at the house all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know you were planning this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94D   Fairbanks stares down his son. Troy is silent and a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...wishing you could sip on Henny out yo crunk cup without a Bitch giving you the side-eye?" (and then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You write this Troy? Troy looks up at his father embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Mine wasn't chosen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you wanted to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I wanted didn't matter then. Why should it matter now? I told you about the party, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94              The invite came from the Pastiche Facebook account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loathe Facebook. An OFFICIAL whispers something in Fairbanks' ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've used that line on me before this year Mr. Fletcher. When a homophobic message mysteriously appeared on a voice mail line you shared with a roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were your intentions when you went back the second time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By any means necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone once told me...Manchester is like jazz. I don't know much about jazz. But from what I can tell, when your solo's up, you better blow. Fairbanks fights a smile.

dialogues.speaker: 94C SAM
dialogues.text: All I did that night was hit record brother. The Dean takes a gulp from a glass of water. He stands an looks out his huge windows onto the campus below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94E   The Dean has Facebook opened on his computer. Offic are taking a break. Drinking water. Discussing the day. The Dean tries a few passwords.

dialogues.speaker: 94C DEAN FAIRBANKS
dialogues.text: Want to hear something strange? The Dean turns from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pastiche group page hadn't been used for months, until the invite went out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94E   The Dean tries a different password. Still invalid.

dialogues.speaker: 94C SAM
dialogues.text: Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what's interesting is how easy it was to access the group before the note was sent. The password was "Pa$tiche" spelled with a dollar sign according to Kurt. Seems recently it's been changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94E   The Dean tries one more. It works.

dialogues.speaker: 94C DEAN FAIRBANKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Couldn't figure it out at first. Then I thought to try something. Five, seven, eight, three, five, twenty six, one, nine, four, six. Eleven numbers. Just like our student ID numbers. Just like your student ID number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as you hate him, you will stop at nothing to protect your master and his boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you send out the invite Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That invite, whoever sent it should've been met with derision and outrage. Instead, a hundred people showed up and they pulled out posters and decorations and costumes they'd made for just such an occasion. Sam and Dean Fairbanks at a stalemate. Silence falls in the room. The Dean's mind ticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pack of EMERALD BUGLE newspapers hit the stand with the headline: "INVESTIGATION INCONCLUSIVE! FLETCHER GOES FREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to it is another stack of papers from the INDEPENDEN OBSERVER. The headline reads: "EBONY & IVY: CAN THERE

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: George picks up a copy of the Observer and starts to read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel flips through his own article as well. A satisfied grin on his face as a razor makes its way through his hai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 Chainz? Shaft? While endless complex depictions of whites, white men in particular exist - there aren't that many versions of us in the culture. His locks waft towards the ground as Troy styles a fresh fearless fro-hawk atop Lionel's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Culture has a powerful way of telling people what they can and can't be. For people of color the options are rather limited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next James Baldwin up in here. Wait hold on a sec. Star Trek is back from commercial break. Troy and Lionel watch in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe is just about finished with Lionel's article too. Lo up just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Sam. Sam sneers at his formalities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read about Armstrong / Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Prez made an executive withdrawal. Armstrong stays Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congrats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a shrug) Getting too dramatic man. Thinking about getting an apartment off campus. We'll see. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam going against the grain? Shocked. How's papa White? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's recovering. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Well... Gabe fights the urge to hug her. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were actually on the phone last night for hours. First time we talked since the bypass. He was putting up a strong front. Teasing me about being so worried. Then came the stories about me as a little girl I'd heard a thousand times. About how independent I was. Gabe smiles politely. Senses she needs a moment. GABE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to talk about it? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother worked nights so he would take me to school. And it pissed me off because he would follow me all the way to homeroom. Every time he tried to hold my hand I'd scream and pull away. He thought I was just being...difficult. A hint of recognition in Gabe. Is this about them? SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it was the kids. And the parents and the teachers. They'd see this Black girl and this white man and wonder what we were doing together. Even at nine I could feel their eyes on me. Especially at nine. It brought tears to my eyes. Gabe's stone face melts at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just a bratty girl, didn't know any better but-- The thought of losing him-- You know? I just feel so bad. How awful am I to do that to him? To anyone I love? Gabe gets it. This is an explanation. An apology, to him. arm is on her shoulder now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he forgives you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think so? Gabe nods. Sam's normal defenses come back up lest she cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So anyway. I didn't mean to say all of that. I don't know why I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Lunch? Gabe starts to walk with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it Mac and Cheese day at Armstrong/Parker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think they'll let you in? Gabe smiles. They walk a bit. Then he grabs her hand. Sam lets the moment happen. Squeezes his back. They look into each others' eyes. Don't even notice as Reggie and the Bofros pass them by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco sits across from Helmut. He's got his eyes on a Yout clip from Sam's movie featuring Coco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this may come as a shock, but they don't give a fuck about no Harriet muthafuckin Tubman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred thousand views. Look they even auto-tuned it. With a click Helmut pulls it up. AUTOTUNED COCO (YOUTUBE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muthafuckin Tubman! Muthatfuckin Tubman! Don't give a fuck about no muthafuckin Tubman! Coco's not sure what to think. HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple months, that's how long shooting for an episode takes. We recommend you cut your course load in half to accommodate the schedule. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half? HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me it it'll read "full-time" in the episode. If...once we go to series, we might have to figure out a summer schedule. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For shooting? HELMUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For uh...classes and stuff. Won't be graduating early anymore sweetheart. Helmut shifts a contract over to Coco. HELMUT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five grand for the episode. Twenty each if you get picked up for series. What do you say? Coco stares at the contract and back at Helmut. HELMUT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me sweetie it's the same out there as it is in here. Good news is? Against all that damn white you and I? We pop. Think I wanted to be the go-to producer for all things Black?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what's worse though. Being that broke Nigga stuck on the south side of Chicago. Hundred and Fiftieth street. Coco takes a deep breath. Stares right into his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco exits a building and spots Troy up ahead. He's flank by his former enemies turned supporters, Reggie and the o BoFros. They all carry Troy's "New Hope" posters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made some new friends? Troy shrugs as Coco grabs for his hand. He pulls away and shares a glance with Reggie, who doesn't approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Coco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Coco starts to walk ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad saw your videos. He's a little worried about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- how it'll look. With your campaign and all. What's your best friend Reggie think? Troy motions for Reggie to go on ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had fun, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get everyone else wants you to win Troy. But do you? Troy doesn't know how to answer that. He stares at the triumphant, winning version of himself on his poster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco's eyes shift longingly as she walks ahead - unsure o who she is at the moment and who she will be in the next. Watching her is Lionel and Sam - sitting with Gabe and Sungmi. They both know that look well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Lionel. With me out and Troy moving on - A/P's going to need a new head of house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think there's a story there? Who do you think it'll be? Sam and Sungmi share a glance and stare right at Lionel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone loves you. Won't be hard to rally the vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We got you man. Lionel takes in this moment. One of complete acceptance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairbanks turns from the window in Fletcher's office to j him at his desk. They're all ears as they look across to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight. First you tried to break up the Black house. Then you took down the sister with the little radio show. And after all that, your kid throws a Blackface party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought you were having money problems before? Wait till cable gets their hands on this story. Bill Maher is gon' fuck you up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have heard enough --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Wait I'm sorry. Look from where I'm sitting this place is a goldmine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one we got to show the events that led up to the party --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That already happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah, but we can reenact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- reenact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Documentary term...Look, I can start putting together an overall deal today. I'm talking real money! Turns out the one thing America likes in it's reality more than ignant Black folks, is crazy racist White people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you look here. This is an honorable institution. The idea that we would so much as entertain this suggestion -- Fletcher holds his hand up. His turn to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much we talking? Fairbanks' outrage turns to resignation as Helmut, the on winner here smiles. Dollar signs in his eyes.
